article:
'Sir Andrew Large' was Deputy Governor of the Bank of England, and a member of
its Monetary Policy Committee from September 2002 to January 2006.

Andrew McLeod Brooks Large was born 7 August 1942, the son of Major
General Stanley Eyre Large, MBE, and was educated at Winchester College
and Corpus Christi College, Cambridge (BA Honours and MA), and at INSEAD
Fontainebleau (MBA).

His career began with British Petroleum Ltd (1964â71). Subsequently he was an
investment banker for twenty years becoming a member of the management board of
Swiss Bank Corporation from 1987-1989. He was Chairman of the Securities and
Investments Board (precursor of the Financial Services Authority FSA) from
1992â1997, and deputy chairman of Barclays Bank from 1998-2002.

He was Warden of Winchester College until he retired from that post in
September 2008.

His wife, Susan, Lady Large, was appointed the new High Sheriff of Powys at a
ceremony in Brecon Guildhall on April 3, 2012.
